intro: Inula conyza, commonly known as goatweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive inflorescence structure. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in flat-topped clusters, producing small achenes as fruits. Inula conyza is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in disturbed environments.
